thread.title: U.S. U20s beat Honduras on penalties to win first CONCACAF Championship
thread.title_full: U.S. U20s beat Honduras on penalties to win first CONCACAF Championship

author: Associated Press
title: U.S. U20s beat Honduras on penalties to win first CONCACAF Championship
text:
U.S. U20s beat Honduras on penalties to win first CONCACAF Championship The United States' players celebrate their first CONCACAF Championship on Sunday. 
Danny Acosta scored the winning goal in a penalty shootout as the United States beat Honduras to win the CONCACAF U20 Championship in San Jose, Costa Rica. 
The U.S. won 5-3 on penalties after a 0-0 draw. Acosta slotted his penalty kick into the lower-left corner to give the U.S. their first CONCACAF title at the U20 level. CHAMPIONS! History is made! The U-20 #USMNT defeat Honduras 5-3 in penalties to capture U.S. Soccer's first U-20 @CONCACAF crown! pic.twitter.com/8Plx8v36vA - U.S. Soccer YNT (@ussoccer_ynt) March 5, 2017 
The U.S. converted all of their penalty kicks, with Brooks Lennon, Coy Craft, Emmanuel Sabbi and Luca De La Torre connecting before Acosta. Jorge Alvarez, Douglas Martinez and Foslyn Grant converted for Honduras. Rembrandt Flores missed. 
The U.S. will play in the FIFA U20 World Cup on May 20-June 11 in South Korea.
